page.title: 07HARESCOMBE CHURCH
page.content: The Church at{Harescombe}is 672 years old, dedicated to St John the Baptist, having long standing links with{ {Gloucester Cathedral}. It has 2 bells, one being the most ancient bell in the diocese. There is a Norman font which is 700 years old. The church can seat 80 and its oldest part is near the entrance on the South side. On the electoral roll, there are 27 but attendance at services varies from 10 to 12. The Reverend Canon Bird has two other churches so services are held on a rota basis. The Rector lives in Stroud. He has many hobbies including steam trains, architecture and walking.
